title: Font used in a Book from Hermann Zapf (1954)
content:
[http://www.typogabor.com/manuale-hermann-zapf/images/Manuale\_HZapf027.jp...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071228061751/http:/www.typogabor.com/manuale-hermann-zapf/images/Manuale_HZapf027.jpg "http://www.typogabor.com/manuale-hermann-zapf/images/Manuale\_HZapf027.jpg")

I would like to know which font is used in the words “Aprés les choses”? (also in the rest of the paragraph...)

thanks in advance.

Derya

 [‹ Looking for a free font similar to old western font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071228061751/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34727 "Go to previous forum topic") [Monoline Script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071228061751/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34719 "Go to next forum topic")
author: derya

comments.content: Kompakt and Baskerville my dear Derya. Next time I advise you to send me an e-mail directly, I’m not surveying all RSS feeds, all the time. It was an chance to find your post. ;-)

Alainch: thanks, for the quick response!  
Peter: Sorry, about that, I didn’t knew that you are a member of typophile (but I should have known...) and I can’t speak french, so I decided to try it here.

;-)  
Derya
